Package inventorySystem

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
inventorySystem.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
The Inventory Class is used to manage items created with the class Item
It can do:
Storing items
Adding items
Listing stored items
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Judit

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Inventory()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addItem(Item item)
    Adds items to the inventory
    If the item is breakable it gets added directly to the inventory with a new index
    If the item is not breakable and we aleady have at least one in the inventory, the quantity variable of the item gets up by "1"
    If the item is not breakable and we don't have-it in the inventory already, it gets added directly to the inventory with a new index
    The item ID is used to check wheter we have it in the inventory or not
    String
    returnAdvanced()
    Returns the entire inventory in ths format
    index + name + description + newline + ID + Is it tool?
    String
    returnInventory()
    Returns the entire inventory in the format
    index + name + quantity or durability (depending of item)
    Item
    returnSingle(int index)
    Returns a single item object from the inventory

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      Parameters:

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Item item)
      Adds items to the inventory
      If the item is breakable it gets added directly to the inventory with a new index
      If the item is not breakable and we aleady have at least one in the inventory, the quantity variable of the item gets up by "1"
      If the item is not breakable and we don't have-it in the inventory already, it gets added directly to the inventory with a new index
      The item ID is used to check wheter we have it in the inventory or not
      Parameters:
      item - Item to add
